place.name: COTHAM
place.gazetteerText: COTHAM, a parish in Newark district, Notts; on the river Devon, near the meeting-point of Notts, Lincoln, and Leicester, 4¾ miles W by S of Claypole r. station, and 4¾ S of Newark. . Post town, Newark. Acres, 1, 210. Real property, £1, 819. Pop., 95. Houses, 22. The property is all in one estate. The living is a donative curacy in the diocese of Lincoln. Value, £35. Patron, the Duke of Portland. The church is good. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
